title.native: 古見さんは、コミュ症です。

description:
Timid Tadano is a total wallflower, and that’s just the way he likes it. But all that changes when he finds himself alone in a classroom on the first day of high school with the legendary Komi. He quickly realizes she isn’t aloof—she’s just super awkward. Now he’s made it his mission to help her on her quest to make 100 friends!

(Source: Viz Media)
synonyms: โฉมงามพูดไม่เก่งกับผองเพื่อนไม่เต็มเต็ง

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Agender
tags.description: Prominently features agender characters.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: Femboy
tags.description: Features a boy who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of girls.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Chuunibyou
tags.description: Prominently features a character with "Middle School 2nd Year Syndrome", who either acts like a know-it-all adult or falsely believes they have special powers.

tags.name: Maids
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a maid.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Gangs
tags.description: Centers around gang organizations.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

title.native: 古見さんは、コミュ症です。
シンデレラ
古見さんは、コミュ症です。2

name.native: ブリドカット・セーラ・恵美

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%B8%A1%E8%BE%BA%E6%AD%A9)

Ayumu Watanabe is a director, screenwriter, storyboard artist and a former animator.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kazuki_kawagoe)

Affiliated with [BUG FILMS](https://anilist.co/studio/7348/). Formerly affiliated with [OLM](https://anilist.co/studio/28/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/_7265687568142)

Freelancer with a desk at [Studio Deen](https://anilist.co/studio/37/). Nakajima is strongly associated with the animated adaptations of the works of [Rumiko Takahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/96891/), having worked as an animation director on [Urusei Yatsura](https://anilist.co/anime/1293/), [Maison Ikkoku](https://anilist.co/anime/1453/) and [Ranma ½](https://anilist.co/anime/210/) also also serving as the character designer on latter.

She is married to [Tomohiro Hirata](https://anilist.co/staff/122071/).

[Website](http://hitodama.info/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/hitodama1103/)

A Japanese singer, songwriter, radio personality and scriptwriter.

She has released 17 singles and 11 albums since her debut as a 13-year-old in 1994. Several of her songs have been used as anime theme songs. She is often mistaken for a voice actress because she is in the same field of activity as idol-esque voice actresses. When she is working as a screenwriter, she goes by the name Deko Akao, an alias made up from her senior [Satoru Akahori](https://anilist.co/staff/97460/)'s name.

Mother of a son and twin daughters.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/209351/)._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/magicmagico) He joined Okayasu Promotion after graduating and studied there as editor, he collected experience on tv animation and drama and gave his debut on Ninja Hattori. He is currently working for 1000 Yamakoshi. Not to be confused with the other Toshihiko Kojima whose name is written with different Kanji.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YukaliHashimoto) | [Blog (jp)](http://blog.livedoor.jp/marianne_amplifier/)

She is a composer, arranger and synthesizer programmer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/__kitri) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC0LTDFHV9KdULlc0kQhDi0w) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/__kitri/)

Members:
- [Mona](https://anilist.co/staff/340496/Mona) - Vocal & lower part of piano
- [Hina](https://anilist.co/staff/340495/Hina) - Vocal, higher part of piano, guitar & percussion

__[Website](https://cidergirl.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/cidergirl_info)__

__Formed:__ 2014
__Genres:__ Rock

__Introduction:__
Cidergirl is a Japanese four-piece rock band under record label Universal J, having previously been under CIDER RECORDS (2015–2016). They made their major debut in 2017.

__Members:__
- [Yurin](https://anilist.co/staff/169465) (ゆりん) – vocalist, guitarist and in-charge of lyrics and composition
- [Tomo](https://twitter.com/ramu_gt) (知, とも) – guitarist
- [Fujimura](https://twitter.com/moff_P) (フジムラ) – bassist
- Shintani Manager (深谷マネージャー) – drummer and manager (2017–Oct. 2018, May. 2019–)

__Former Members:__
- [Toruru](https://twitter.com/twittoruru) (トルル) – drummer

__Support Members:__
- [komaki](https://twitter.com/komaki1986) – drummer 
- [Chihiro Hosokawa](https://twitter.com/sngk_hskw) (細川千弘) – drummer
- [Yuusuke Yoshida](https://twitter.com/yoshidayusuke) (吉田雄介), better known by stage name Yoshida-kun (吉田くん) – drummer and percussionist

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/佐藤和巳)

Originating from Studio Giants' in-between department, Studio Lions.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1949484145)

Affiliated with [BUG FILMS](https://anilist.co/studio/7348). He was previously affiliated with [OLM](https://anilist.co/studio/28/OLM).
